questions.question: What is the empirical formula of the amine-templated one-dimensional cobalt-fluoro-sulfate synthesized under solvothermal condition?
What temperature was used for the solvothermal synthesis of the cobalt-fluoro-sulfate containing Co4F4 Cubane?
How does the magnetic susceptibility behavior of the Co4F4 cubane chain change with temperature?
questions.answer: The magnetic susceptibility shows low-temperature magnetic ordering below 17 K attributed to intra-cluster ferromagnetic coupling.

questions.question: What is the overpotential required by CoSe2@ST to achieve the benchmark current density of 10 mA cm−2 in an acidic medium?
True or False: The synthesis of CoSe2@HT requires an external reducing agent.
What is the role of the N-doped carbon matrix in the HER performance of CoSe2@ST?
questions.answer: The N-doped carbon matrix facilitates faster charge transfer at the electrode–electrolyte interface and higher electrochemical conductivity than CoSe2@HT.

questions.question: True or False: The sealed tube method for synthesizing CoSe2@ST is solvent-free and does not require an external reducing agent.
What is the Tafel slope for CoSe2@ST, and what does it indicate about its HER kinetics?
questions.answer: 48 mV dec−1, indicating faster reaction kinetics for CoSe2@ST than CoSe2@HT.

questions.question: True or False: The electrochemical stability test of CoSe2@ST showed a significant change in overpotential after 35 hours.
What morphological feature of CoSe2@ST is confirmed by TEM and HR-TEM analysis?
questions.answer: Nanorods of CoSe2 encapsulated with carbon matrix.

questions.question: True or False: The ECSA of CoSe2@HT is lower than that of CoSe2@ST.
How does the presence of a carbon matrix in CoSe2@ST affect its charge transfer resistance compared to CoSe2@HT?
questions.answer: CoSe2@ST has a lower charge transfer resistance than CoSe2@HT, indicating better charge transfer between the catalyst and electrolyte.

questions.question: True or False: The HER activity of CoSe2@ST in an alkaline medium follows the same trend as in an acidic medium.
What is the specific activity of CoSe2@ST compared to CoSe2@HT, and what does it reveal?
questions.answer: CoSe2@ST exhibits higher specific activity than CoSe2@HT, revealing its higher intrinsic activity.

questions.question: True or False: The synthesis of the Co4F4 cubane chain involves the use of hydrofluoric acid.
What is the role of NaBH4 in the synthesis of CoSe2@HT?
questions.answer: NaBH4 acts as a reducing agent in the hydrothermal synthesis of CoSe2@HT.

questions.question: True or False: The magnetic properties of the Co4F4 cubane chain exhibit spin-glass freezing.
How does the synthesis method affect the morphology of CoSe2 nanomaterials?
questions.answer: The hydrothermal method results in sphere-like morphologies, while the sealed tube method results in nanorods wrapped with an activated carbon matrix.

questions.question: True or False: The HER performance of CoSe2@ST is solely attributed to the presence of cobalt selenide nanorods.
What evidence supports the formation of an N-doped activated carbon matrix in CoSe2@ST?
questions.answer: Raman spectroscopy, XPS analysis, and TEM images confirm the presence of an N-doped activated carbon matrix in CoSe2@ST.
